Posts.Content: SecretlyDistressed wrote: I was recently diagnosed with 3 different types of breast cancer. 2 very aggressive. Triple Negative included of course. However, it most likely has not metastasized yet. I will get a PET scan Thursday. The medical oncologist wanted to start heavy duty chemo in 2 weeks or less. So I’m scheduled to start in just over a week. I don’t have a good support system, so I will be dealing with the side effects all alone. I don’t think I can get thru it. I just don’t. So I feel since there’s likely no metastasis, why should I suffer thru chemo unnecessarily? Does anyone have an opinion on this Dx 10/4/2018, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, ER+/PR-, HER2- (IHC) Dx 10/4/2018, IDC, Right, <1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- (IHC) Dx 10/4/2018, IDC, Right, <1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Dx 10/4/2018, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Chemotherapy 10/22/2018 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxol (paclitaxel) Targeted Therapy Perjeta (pertuzumab) Hormonal Therapy Radiation Therapy Whole-breast: Breast Surgery Mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anyone refused Chemo? SecretlyDistressed SecretlyDistressed
